name: Mixed Bag 12 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [B] | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who portrayed Lt. Col. James Doolittle in the 1944 movie 'Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo'?
questions.explanation:
Spencer Tracy.

	Also starred Van Johnson, Robert Walker and Robert Mitchum among others for a strong cast.

questions.text: How wide is the Statue of Liberty's mouth?
There are over 20,000 known varieties of fish?
questions.explanation:
True.

	Actually there are aproximately 25,000 recognized species.

questions.text: How old was Elizabeth Taylor when she made her movie debut?
questions.explanation:
10.

	In the 1942 movie 'There's One Born Every Minute'.

questions.text: The U.S. standard number two can for fruits and vegetables holds how many cups?
questions.explanation:
2½.

	A standard #2 can is approx 20 ounces - 8 oz per cup equals 2½ cups.

questions.text: Which coffee company sponsored Edgar Bergen's radio program?
questions.explanation:
Chase and Sanborn.

	Edgar was one of the most popular ventriloquists with his dummy Charlie McCarthy.

questions.text: 'Dr. Octopus' is the arch enemy of which comic book hero?
How many movies did Clark Gable and Joan Crawford make together?
questions.explanation:
8.

	Clark Gable made movies with virtually every MGM female star.

questions.text: An ocelot may weigh up to how many pounds?
questions.explanation:
30.

	The tree ocelot or marlay may weigh up to 35 pounds.

questions.text: Kleenex Tissues were originally made for gas mask filters in World War One?
